title: GOP Divided on Defense of Trump Over Ukraine
summary: Divergence shows party's challenges to mount a unified front ahead of public impeachment hearings this week. WASHINGTON-Top Republicans on Sunday offered sharply divergent views of President Trump's interactions with Ukraine, showcasing the party's challenges to mount a unified defense of the president in advance of public impeachment hearings set to begin this week.

title: Southern Europe Stays Unstable
summary: Spain's divided voters render another muddled decision.. Spain held its fourth general election in four years on Sunday, and it could be weeks before Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez or his rivals form a government, if they ever do. The results underscore the sharp electoral divisions and lack of a clear majority direction in Western democracies.

title: Bernard Tyson, Chairman and CEO of Kaiser Permanente, Dies at 60
summary: Mr. Tyson was a high-profile voice in U.S. health policy. Kaiser Permanente Chief Executive Bernard Tyson, a high-profile voice in U.S. health policy, died unexpectedly Sunday.

title: Bolivian President Resigns After Re-Election Marred by Fraud Allegations
summary: Move follows Evo Morales's pledge to hold new poll after monitor said October vote must be annulled and after weeks of protests over allegations of fraud. Embattled Bolivian President Evo Morales fled the capital La Paz and resigned after the head of the armed forces, Gen. Williams Kaliman, suggested that he leave power in the wake of an Oct. 20 presidential vote that electoral monitors said was marred by fraud.

title: Veterans Day Draws Trump and His New York Rivals
summary: President is set to give speech and local leaders are expected to march. President Trump has moved his legal residence to Florida, but he is still in a New York state of mind.

title: Spain's Socialists Fall Short of Majority as Right-Wing Surges
summary: The elections, Spain's second this year and fourth in four years, show how political fragmentation is making it harder to govern European countries. Spain's incumbent Socialists came first in national elections Sunday but fell short of a majority in Parliament, while right-wing parties made gains reflecting many voters' anger about Catalan separatism.

title: Man Dies After Stabbing in New York Homeless Shelter
summary: Manhattan homeless shelter is run by a nonprofit that is currently under investigation by the city. A man was stabbed to death during a fight inside a Manhattan homeless shelter run by a nonprofit that is currently under investigation by the city for alleged undisclosed ties to a for-profit security firm, police officials said.

title: Liverpool Routs City to Seize Control of Premier League Title Race
summary: Although six months still remain in the season, Liverpool is now nine points clear of the defending champions. LIVERPOOL, England-Once he finished his victory lap around the Anfield pitch, and once he'd run down the tunnel pounding the crest over his heart, Liverpool manager Jürgen Klopp calmed down enough to deliver all the usual caveats.

title: Viacom and CBS Shake Up Executive Ranks Ahead of Combination
summary: Comedy Central Chief Kent Alterman and Media Networks COO Sarah Levy are expected to depart. Viacom Inc. and CBS Corp. are realigning the leadership of their creative operations in advance of the expected closing of their merger in early December, people familiar with the matter said.

title: Boeing Seeks Blessing to Deliver 737 MAX as FAA Reviews Pilot Training
summary: Plane maker discussing whether it can deliver aircraft before pilots have undergone required training. Boeing Co. hopes to deliver 737 MAX aircraft to airlines before the end of the year even if regulators haven't approved related pilot training, people familiar with the matter said.

title: President's Eldest Son Relishing His Part in 2020 Campaign
summary: Donald Trump Jr. is taking a leading campaign role. MIRAMAR BEACH, Fla.-Defending dad on the campaign trail, on social media and with a new book, the president's eldest son Donald Trump Jr. is relishing his role as a political combatant heading into 2020.

title: Kicking and Sparring Bring This Family Together
summary: Resume Subscription. Parents typically don't bond with their teenagers by fighting. But Stephanie Espinoza says taekwondo lessons have brought her and her 19-year-old daughter, Anna, closer together.

title: The Proxy Protection Racket
summary: The SEC shines some sunlight on a cozy business duopoly.. Union pension funds promote transparency and democracy in corporate governance-so we're told, and at least when it serves their political purposes. But look who's now opposing the Securities and Exchange Commission's efforts to break up a corporate protection racket by proxy firm duopolists.

title: Nonwitnesses for Impeachment
summary: Democrats now don't care to hear from Bolton or Kupperman.. House Democrats open the public phase of their impeachment hearings this week, but the process isn't gaining credibility with their decision to limit witnesses.

title: Mayor Pete's Latest Trillions
summary: His 'economic' agenda is all spending and taxes and no growth.. Pete Buttigieg is getting a hard look from anxious Democrats. If Joe Biden can't perform better and Elizabeth Warren seems unelectable, then who's on deck? Maybe it's Pete, the mild Midwestern mayor. Over the past month Mr. Buttigieg has risen steadily in the Real Clear Politics polling average to a solid fourth place, with about 7% support.

title: Tencent Looks to Leverage Its Partnership With Nintendo in the U.S.
summary: World's biggest videogame maker seeks a greater U.S. presence with more console games designed for American gamers. China's Tencent Holdings Ltd., the world's largest videogame company by revenue, is looking to make more console games for U.S. consumers by leveraging its partnership with Japan's Nintendo Co. , Tencent officials said.

title: Supreme Court to Consider Futures of Thousands of DACA 'Dreamers'
summary: Trump administration wants to cancel a reprieve from deportation President Obama granted to undocumented immigrants brought to the U.S. as children. WASHINGTON-For most of his life, Carlo Barrera, whose family traveled to Austin, Texas, from northern Mexico when he was 6 and overstayed their visas, didn't know he was in the U.S. illegally. In retrospect, he says, there were clues.

title: Economy Week Ahead: German Recession Watch, U.S. Retail Sales, Powell Talks to Congress
summary: Fed Chairman Powell is set to testify on the economic outlook before the Joint Economic Committee on Wednesday. The later part of the week will be busy with economic news. We'll learn whether Germany has slipped into recession and if China's business activity has cooled further, and we'll get a gauge of the all-important American consumer. Plus, Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell will testify before Congress.

title: 'The Force' Review: Extraordinary Irregulars
summary: A U.S.-Canadian unit created during World War II and stocked with hunters, climbers, foresters and woodsmen proved the value of special forces.. When I was a boy, back in the 1970s in Australia, I was taken to see a veterans' parade. There they were, all these old men in their bemedaled blazers and striped ties and black berets and gray slacks and comfortable shoes muscle-memoriedly marching down the street, accompanied by golf claps as they passed. I was 8 or 9, and it was there I first heard chatter of some place called "Gallipoli."

title: Welcome to China. You Probably Can't Buy Anything, Though.
summary: Foreign tourists in China looking to buy a bottle of water or a taxi ride with cash or credit card are finding themselves out of luck. BEIJING-On her first trip to China, 30-year-old Courtney Newnham from Portland, Ore., eagerly lined up at a street pushcart to buy a skewer of candied hawthorn berries, a traditional snack.

title: Rising Yields Quiet Bond Market's Key Recession Alarm
summary: Recent interest-rate cuts by the Fed and improvement in U.S.-China trade relations fuel optimism. A closely watched barometer of economic expectations is encouraging investors to take risks again.

title: Warren Is the WeWork Candidate
summary: What do 'Community Adjusted Ebitda' and Medicare for All have in common?. Are presidential candidate Elizabeth Warren and WeWork founder Adam Neumann the same person? I mean, they have different hairstyles and all, but their philosophies are more alike than not.

title: Mexico Loses Its Sovereignty to Cartels
summary: President López Obrador's strategy to negotiate with drug capos is not working.. The Mexican military has a long history of obedience to the civilian government. So when a seasoned general delivers a speech to the army and air force hierarchy criticizing the president, something is afoot. Not surprisingly, it had to do with the government's loss of authority over large parts of the country to organized crime.

title: What We Know About Vaping-Related Lung Illness
summary: Doctors, officials urge people to stop vaping as they investigate hundreds of cases of pulmonary illness and dozens of people die. Health officials are investigating more than 2,000 confirmed and probable cases of pulmonary illness in the U.S. related to vaping and e-cigarette products and dozens of people have died.

title: What We Can Learn From Oscar the Grouch
summary: Respect isn't respect if it's dished out like a participation trophy.. A creature emerged from a trash can 50 years ago, on Nov. 10, 1969. The creators of "Sesame Street" blessed Oscar the Grouch with a searching spirit. His can is a kingdom of wonders, using the old Doctor Who trick of being bigger on the inside than it appears from the outside. (It boasts multiple floors, a moat and an art annex.) With his vast music and book collections, Oscar is a true aesthete.

title: Cold Welcome for Veterans on Campus
summary: Students at elite colleges seek to undermine the values that service members signed up to defend.. 'But don't you ever feel like a sucker for serving?"

title: The Quantum Computing Threat to American Security
summary: Google claims supremacy, but the risk remains that U.S. complacency lets China crack all its codes.. Google announced last month that it had achieved "quantum supremacy," demonstrating the potential of a new kind of computer that can perform certain tasks many orders of magnitude faster than the most advanced supercomputers. It's a crucial moment for America's national security, which depends on winning the race to do what quantum computers will do best: decrypt the vast majority of existing public-key encryption systems.

title: Biden's Plan for Health is Already a Failure
summary: ObamaCare was supposed to improve the individual market. It made it worse.. Most Democratic presidential candidates are supporting some version of Medicare for All, a radical proposal to put Washington in complete control of the health-care system. Joe Biden, however, promises to "protect and build on the Affordable Care Act," the last Washington health-care experiment, which is better known as ObamaCare.

title: Make Pluto Great Again
summary: As the debate over its planetary status heats up again, NASA contemplates sending another probe.. In astronomy as in politics, no issue is truly settled until it has become irrelevant. The question of Pluto-planet, dwarf planet or Kuiper belt object?-is still up for debate. "I believe Pluto is a planet," NASA Administrator Jim Bridenstine announced. He may not be an astrophysicist but his agency controls a very large chunk of the Earth's budget for space science, so he's not a man the American astronomy establishment can easily ignore.

title: Mexico, U.S. Must Cooperate to End Violence
summary: Strengthening our rule of law, bringing criminals to justice, eliminating impunity while ensuring the protection of human rights is an absolute priority of this government.. Regarding your editorial "The Cartelization of Mexico" (Nov. 6): As President Andrés Manuel López Obrador has stated, the Mexican government respects the Journal's opinion. However, we disagree with both your diagnosis of the issue and your conclusion. The last sentence says a U.S. military operation in Mexico "can't be ruled out." Such an approach would be completely disproportionate and come at a massive cost to Mexico, the U.S. and our bilateral community.

title: What Was Tolerated Is Becoming Mandatory
summary: It is interesting and thought-provoking to see stories about diverse relationships, but is there still space for an extraordinary rom-com without a "wait for it" LGBTQ-plus twist?. Regarding your Life & Arts television and film reviews (Oct. 25): As someone who is woke just enough to know that I am basically unwoke, I broach the topic of 21st-century culture and entertainment with trepidation and humility. I do not believe that I harbor in my heart any ill-will toward people who have a sexual orientation different than my own and I do my best not to be judgmental about the political orientations of others. However, I again am woke enough to know that Hillary Clinton says that I cannot escape my implicit bias or my white, male privilege and Christian moral code so, for the most part, I try to keep my mouth shut.

title: Refugees Are Still Living The All-American Dream
summary: She's an American-a fine example of why we should, in Mr. Snyder's words, "say yes to refugees.". Regarding Gov. Rick Snyder's "Refugees Live the American Dream" (op-ed, Oct. 30): Eleven years ago, we were the receiving family for a young woman refugee from the Balkans. She possessed a fierce determination to get a job from the day she arrived in the U.S., despite limited English language and numeracy skills.

title: Jewish Settlements Go Mainstream in Israel
summary: Resume Subscription. ARIEL, West Bank-When the Jewish settlers who founded this town scouted the land in 1978, they chose a rocky outcrop where Palestinian villagers warned nothing would grow. It was called the Mountain of Death.

title: Louisiana: The Trial-Lawyer State
summary: John Bel Edwards has encouraged lawsuits that have cost jobs.. Louisiana used to be a leader in U.S. energy production, but Governor John Bel Edwards has turned it into a leading lawsuit producer instead. Jobs have declined while taxes and auto insurance rates have risen.

title: LSU Triumphs in Game of the Century: Part II
summary: In addition to the Tigers, No. 1 Ohio State, No. 5 Clemson, No. 12 Baylor and No. 17 Minnesota have perfect records. TUSCALOOSA, Ala.-It took less than three minutes for No. 3 Alabama to preview what would be in store on Saturday against No. 2 LSU. In his first drive since having ankle surgery three weeks ago, quarterback Tua Tagovailoa took the snap on third down with 8 yards between him and the end zone. He cut wide right, and as he charged toward a touchdown, he simply dropped the ball.

title: How a Former Twitter Employee Became an Accused Saudi Spy
summary: Ahmad Abouammo has been charged with acting as an agent of the Saudi Arabian government. Ahmad Abouammo for years lived a Seattle lifestyle not unlike many of his neighbors. He owned a million dollar house, drove an Audi sport-utility vehicle and worked at Amazon.com Inc.

title: Aramco's Big Profit Slide Shows Scale of Risk Ahead of IPO
summary: Saudi Arabia's ability to protect Aramco's facilities will be an important factor for investors calculating the company's value in its planned IPO. DUBAI-Aramco revealed a steep drop in profit related to attacks on its facilities in September that briefly halved the Saudi company's oil output, highlighting the risks to investors ahead of what could be the world's largest initial public offering.

title: The Iron Curtain Is Gone, but Europe's East and West Are Again Divided
summary: Democracy and market economies rule across the continent, but politically the former blocs are drifting apart again 30 years after the Berlin Wall fell. BERLIN-Thirty years after the Berlin Wall fell, ending the Cold War in Europe, new political divisions are rising between East and West.

title: U.S.-Mexico Border Arrests Fall in October
summary: Border Patrol arrested about 36,300 people crossing the U.S.-Mexico border illegally in October. WASHINGTON-The U.S. Border Patrol arrested about 36,300 people crossing the U.S.-Mexico border illegally in October, a 10% drop from the previous month, according to new numbers reviewed by The Wall Street Journal.

title: Elizabeth Warren Seeks to Win Over Black Voters
summary: The Democrat won the endorsement of prominent African-American clergy in Massachusetts, but has struggled to break through in the 2020 race. BOSTON-Rev. Jeff Brown knew his endorsement, along with backing from a slate of other prominent black faith leaders here, would be a boost to Elizabeth Warren in the fall of 2012, when she was in the home stretch of her first political campaign.

title: Blackouts, Wildfires Test California Gov. Newsom in His First Crisis
summary: As governor threatens action on PG&E, taking ownership of the problem could bring political risks. SAN FRANCISCO-California Gov. Gavin Newsom recently ended weeks of traversing burned down, blacked out and evacuated parts of this state with a dramatic promise: If PG&E Corp couldn't fix its own problems, he would consider a government takeover.

title: The Good News About 5G Security
summary: We know about the supply-chain risks that could make 5G vulnerable to spying. But there's another side to this.. Lost amid recent security concerns about Chinese suppliers of next-generation wireless networks, there is a bigger, more positive story: 5G will provide big benefits when it comes to protecting sensitive data.

title: Midtown Manhattan Braces for MTA's Massive 20-Year Construction Job
summary: Resume Subscription. Midtown Manhattan will soon be upended by 20 years of construction as the Metropolitan Transportation Authority begins repairs to an underground entryway to Grand Central Terminal.

title: India's Divided Economy-and a Manufacturing Slump-Slow Its Rise
summary: India's progress in moving workers out of the informal economy is hampered by meager growth. When it comes to its economy, India is divided into two worlds.

title: $100 Million for a Painting? Not This Auction Week
summary: As the art market slows, collectors are turning their gaze to the quirky and overlooked. The art market has gone on a diet. Two years ago, Christie's sold a single painting by Leonardo da Vinci for $450 million during a series of major fall auctions in New York. This week, the auction house will need to sell nearly an entire week's worth of offerings to cross that mark.

title: U.S. Oil's Growth Challenges Investors
summary: Country has added to oil glut that has held down crude prices in recent years. The U.S. has become the world's leading oil producer. That isn't making it any easier on the companies doing the producing.

title: Census Overhaul Seeks to Avoid Outing Individual Respondent Data
summary: Most Census 2020 results will be adjusted; measures would prevent targeting based on citizenship. The Census Bureau is overhauling its systems after it found anyone with sophisticated data tools could use published results to identify millions of individual census respondents, according to agency officials.

title: Farmers Turn to High-Interest Loans as Banks Pull Back
summary: Alternative lenders extend reach during steep agricultural downturn; 'They keep their finger on you.'. Financial stress is mounting in the Farm Belt, pushing more growers to take on high-interest loans outside traditional banks to stay in business.

title: WeWork Drew SEC Scrutiny Just Before It Scrapped IPO
summary: Regulator raised numerous concerns about a metric WeWork called 'contribution margin' as it was trying to court investors, documents show. Just weeks before WeWork expected its stock to begin trading publicly, the startup was still wrangling with the Securities and Exchange Commission over a controversial key financial metric and a litany of other concerns about its planned multibillion-dollar IPO.

title: Unloved Assets Join Market Rally in Latest Sign of Optimism
summary: Several factors weighing on markets, such as Brexit and U.S.-China trade, are showing signs of better-than-expected outcomes. Investors are piling into beaten-up assets from commodities to emerging-market stocks, powering a broad rally that reflects a brightening outlook for the global economy.

title: Japan Celebrates Emperor's Enthronement
summary: Tens of thousands of people greet Emperor Naruhito and Empress Masako as their motorcade passes through Tokyo. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Diageo's India Bet: Woo Local Governments, Win the Market
summary: Johnnie Walker maker is lobbying officials to slash taxes, preempt prohibition in world's largest whiskey market. Johnnie Walker-maker Diageo PLC is betting on India, the world's largest whiskey market, to power its growth. But first, it has to win over dozens of local governments that want to either ban liquor or tax it heavily, even as more Indians embrace drinking.
